flawed_nl_solution:
Christopher has 64 quarters so he has 64*0.25 = $<<64*0.25=16.0>>16.0
Karen has 32 quarters so she has 32*0.25 = $<<32*0.25=8.0>>8.0
If Christopher has $16.0 and Karen has $8.0 then Christopher has 16.0-8.0 = $<<16.0-8.0=11.0>>11.0 more than Karen

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 8.0, not 11.0. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
